ns8:component-version-script.script:
rem Name configure.bat
rem LAST Modified rem 12-October-2012
rem SYNOPSIS rem This script install the ADFS software
rem Author rem Persistent Systems Ltd rem Shweta Malhotra
echo "Install ADFS in silent mode" %adfsinstalller% /quiet
IF %ERRORLEVEL% EQU 0 ( echo "ADFS installed successfully" ) ELSE ( echo "ADFS is not installed successfully" exit /B 1 )

supported-os-details.exec-script: @echo off call %1 >%3 2>&1 if NOT %errorlevel% EQU 0 exit %errorlevel% set > %2

ns8:component-version-script.script:
# Name start.ps1
# LAST Modified # 12-October-2012
# SYNOPSIS # Script: # Create and configure a server authentication certificate in IIS # Configure the computer as a stand-alone federation server
# Author # Persistent Systems Ltd # Shweta Malhotra
# Fetching the host name $computer=gc env:computername write-output $computer
#Create and Configure Server authentication certificate in IIS
function New-SSLCertificate { <# This function creates self-signed SSL certificate and install it to certificate store
Parameter Subject:Specifies subject for certificate.
KeyLength : Specifies private key length. Due of performance and security reasons, only 1024 and 2048 bit are supported. by default 2048 bit key length is used.
NotBefore:By default current date and time is used.
NotAfter : Sets the date in local time after which a certificate is no longer valid. #>
[CmdletBinding()] param ( [Parameter(Mandatory = $true)] [Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName]$Subject, [int][ValidateSet("1024", "2048")]$KeyLength = 2048, [datetime]$NotBefore = [DateTime]::Now, [datetime]$NotAfter = $NotBefore.AddDays(365), [switch]$Force )
$SubjectDN = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX500DistinguishedName $SubjectDN.Encode($Subject.Name, 0x0)
$OID = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CObjectID $OID.InitializeFromValue("1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1") $OIDs = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CObjectIDs $OIDs.Add($OID)
$EKU = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509ExtensionEnhancedKeyUsage $EKU.InitializeEncode($OIDs)
$PrivateKey = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509PrivateKey $PrivateKey.ProviderName = "Microsoft RSA SChannel Cryptographic Provider" $PrivateKey.KeySpec = 0x1 $PrivateKey.KeyUsage = 0xa0 $PrivateKey.Length = $KeyLength $PrivateKey.MachineContext = 0x1 $PrivateKey.ExportPolicy = 1 $PrivateKey.Create()
$Cert = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509CertificateRequestCertificate $Cert.InitializeFromPrivateKey(0x2,$PrivateKey,"") $Cert.Subject = $SubjectDN $Cert.Issuer = $Cert.Subject $Cert.NotBefore = $NotBefore $Cert.NotAfter = $NotAfter $Cert.X509Extensions.Add($EKU) $Cert.Encode()
$Request = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509enrollment # process request $Request.InitializeFromRequest($Cert) $endCert = $Request.CreateRequest(0x1) $Request.InstallResponse(0x2,$endCert,0x1,"")
[Byte[]]$bytes = [System.Convert]::FromBase64String($endCert) $x509store = New-Object Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store "Root", "LocalMachine" $x509store.Open([Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags]::ReadWrite) $x509store.Add([Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2]$bytes) $x509store.Close() }
function Import-PfxCertificate { param([String]$certPath,[String]$certRootStore,[String]$certStore,$pfxPass)
$pfx = new-object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2
if ($pfxPass -eq $null) { $pfxPass = write-output “Enter the pfx password” exit }
$pfx.import($certPath,$pfxPass,“Exportable,PersistKeySet”) $store = new-object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store($certStore,$certRootStore) $store.open(“MaxAllowed”) $store.add($pfx) $store.close() }
function Import-Certificate([string]$Path, [string]$Password, [string]$Container) { <# This function imports the User certificates to Certificate Store
Parameter
Path:Specifies the path to certificate file Password:Specifies the password for the certificate Container:Specifies container within particular Certificate Store location. These containers represent MMC console containers: CA - Intermediate CAs My - Personal Root- Trusted Root CAs
#>
$Storage = "LocalMachine"
if (!(Resolve-Path $Path)) {throw "Looks like your specified certificate file doesn't exist"} $file = gi $Path -Force -ErrorAction Stop $certs = New-Object system.security.cryptography.x509certificates.x509certificate2 switch ($Storage) {
"LocalMachine" {$flags = "MachineKeySet"} } switch -regex ($file.Extension) { ".CER|.DER" {$certs.Import($file.FullName, $null, $flags)} ".PFX" { if (!$password) {throw "For this certificate file password is required." exit } if ($StrongProtection -and $Storage -eq "Computer") { throw "You cannot use Private Key Strong Protection for computer certificates!" } $flags = $flags + ", Exportable" $flags = $flags + ", UserProtected" $certs.Import($file.FullName, $password, $flags) } ".P7B|.SST" { $certs = New-Object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection $certs.Import([System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($file.FullName)) } default {throw "Specified file is not a certificate file"} } $store = New-Object system.security.cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store $Container, $Storage $store.Open([System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags]::ReadWrite) $certs | %{$store.Add($_)} if ($?) { write-output "File is successfully added to container" } $store.Close() }
if($usercert -eq "") { write-output "Create the Self Signed Certificate" New-SSLCertificate -Subject "CN=$computer.$domain" } else {
if ($usercert -like "*.pfx" -and $usercertpb -like "*.p7b") { write-output "Download the User Certificate provided" $clnt = new-object System.Net.WebClient $file="C:\$computer.pfx" $pbfile="C:\$computer.p7b" $clnt.DownloadFile($usercert,$file) $clnt.DownloadFile($usercertpb,$pbfile)
write-output "Import the User Certificate" Import-PfxCertificate $file “localMachine” "MY” $usercert_password Import-Certificate $pbfile $usercert_password "CA" Import-Certificate $pbfile $usercert_password "Root" write-output "User Certificate Imported" } else { write-output "Check the User Certificate file format" exit } }
if(get-childitem cert:\LocalMachine\my | ft issuer, subject) { write-output "Certificate is present in the store" #Import the PowerShell Modules required for configuring IIS Get-Module -ListAvailable | Import-Module cd IIS:
# Extracting thumbprint of the Self Signed Certificate $sslcertificate1=dir cert:\localMachine\MY $thumb=$sslcertificate1.Thumbprint write-output "Thumbprint of the Certificate :" $thumb
#Creating Binding with Self Signed Certificate for the default Web-Site set-variable -name protocol -value https set-variable -name site -value "Default Web Site" New-WebBinding -Name $site -IP "*" -Port 443 -Protocol $protocol Get-WebBinding $site cd SslBindings Get-Item cert:\localMachine\MY\$thumb|New-Item 0.0.0.0!443
# Configure the computer as a stand-alone federation server cd "C:\Program Files\Active Directory Federation Services 2.0" ./FSConfig.exe StandAlone /AutoCertRolloverEnabled if ($?) { write-output "Configured the computer as a stand-alone federation server successfully" } else { write-output "Computer not configured as as a stand-alone federation server" exit } } else { write-output "SSL certificate does not exists in the store" exit }

# Name install.ps1
# LAST Modified # 12-October-2012
# SYNOPSIS # This script adds the machine to AD Domain # Author # Persistent Systems Ltd # Shweta Malhotra
write-output "Changing local admin password" net user Administrator $local_admin_pass
write-output "Updating DNS server in network settings" $wmi = Get-WmiObject win32_networkadapterconfiguration -filter "ipenabled = 'true'" $wmi.SetDNSServerSearchOrder("$dns_ip") write-output "DNS set to : " $dns_ip
write-output "Adding machine to domain " $domain Add-Computer -DomainName $domain -credential (New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential ("$domain\$domain_admin", (ConvertTo-SecureString $domain_pass -AsPlainText -Force))) if($?) { write-output "Host added to domain successfully" } else { write-output "Host is not added to domain" exit }
